sub_topic: The Poincaré map and its use in studying chaotic systems
message_1:
A particle in a chaotic system is described by the dynamical equation x(n+1) = 1.2x(n) + sin(x(n)), where x(n) is the position of the particle at time n. The Poincaré map is created by plotting the position of the particle every time it crosses a particular section of the system (such as x = 0). For this system, assume the first crossing of the section occurs at x(0) = 1. 

What is the position (x) of the particle after the 10th crossing of the section?
